SEARCH
Package model

Class NodeChar

java.lang.Object
model.NodeChar
public class NodeChar extends Object
Represents a node in a doubly linked list of characters for the phone book structure. Each node contains a character (letter) and maintains a reference to a NameList that stores all names starting with that particular letter.

This node is part of the hierarchical structure where characters serve as indexes for organizing names alphabetically in the phone book.

Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • NodeChar

      public NodeChar()
      Constructs an empty NodeChar with null character and no list associations. This constructor is useful for placeholder nodes or temporary instances.

    • NodeChar

      public NodeChar(char letter)
      Constructs a NodeChar with the specified letter and initializes an empty NameList. The node is ready to be linked into the character list and store names starting with the given letter.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character this node represents

  • Method Details

    • getLetter

      public char getLetter()
      Returns the character stored in this node.
      Returns:
      the character represented by this node

    • setLetter

      @Deprecated public void setLetter(char letter)
      Deprecated.
      Changing the letter of an existing node is not safe as it may break the logical structure of the phone book. Letters should remain constant once assigned to maintain data integrity.
      Sets the character for this node.
      Parameters:
      letter - the new character to set

    • getNextChar

      public NodeChar getNextChar()
      Returns the next node in the character list.
      Returns:
      the next NodeChar in the sequence, or null if this is the last node

    • setNextChar

      public void setNextChar(NodeChar nextChar)
      Sets the reference to the next node in the character list.
      Parameters:
      nextChar - the next NodeChar in the sequence

    • getPreviousChar

      public NodeChar getPreviousChar()
      Returns the previous node in the character list.
      Returns:
      the previous NodeChar in the sequence, or null if this is the first node

    • setPreviousChar

      public void setPreviousChar(NodeChar previousChar)
      Sets the reference to the previous node in the character list.
      Parameters:
      previousChar - the previous NodeChar in the sequence

    • getNameList

      public NameList getNameList()
      Returns the NameList associated with this character node. This list contains all names that start with the node's letter.
      Returns:
      the NameList containing names for this letter

    • setNameList

      public void setNameList(NameList nameList)
      Sets the NameList for this character node. Use with caution as it replaces the entire list of names for this letter.
      Parameters:
      nameList - the new NameList to associate with this character
